xwikidoc.name: medsavantArchive20130923
xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 23 September 2013
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 03:59 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 07:49 <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 07:57 <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 12:25 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 12:33 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 12:33 <sdumitriu1> Hey bvancea 12:33 <sdumitriu1> How's it going? 12:35 <bvancea> hey sdumitriu1 12:35 <bvancea> good, I'm finishing my final report 12:35 <bvancea> planning to send it with the status 12:37 <bvancea> I still have some bugs in the code, not sure what to do about them :( 12:37 <bvancea> if the development should stop today 12:40 <bvancea> and you? 12:41 <sdumitriu1> On the final stretch for the PhenoTips release... 12:41 <sdumitriu1> Well, the development for what's being evaluated stops today 12:41 <sdumitriu1> You can always continue fixing things 12:44 <bvancea> I understand 12:45 <sdumitriu1> Did you go around, visiting the neighborhood? 12:45 <bvancea> so I should stop committing until the final evaluation? 12:45 <bvancea> a bit 12:45 <sdumitriu1> No 12:45 <bvancea> I split my time between going to classes and fixing stuff for the final evaluation 12:46 <bvancea> my gf is not very pleased 12:46 <bvancea> ;)) 12:46 <sdumitriu1> But the code that you're going to submit to Google should only include commits up to today 12:46 <bvancea> oh, I understand 12:46 <bvancea> regarding that code 12:46 <bvancea> what code should I send? 12:46 <bvancea> the whole Medsavant ? 12:46 <bvancea> with the client + server + dists 12:46 <sdumitriu1> No... 12:47 <sdumitriu1> With git, you could send all your commits 12:47 <bvancea> hmm 12:47 <bvancea> as a patch somehow? 12:47 <sdumitriu1> Google doesn't actually care, it just has to have something in case they get a tax control and they have to prove that they gave you money for something and they're not just laundering 12:47 <bvancea> oh 12:47 <bvancea> I see 12:48 <bvancea> well, can I select all commits made by me from my feature branch? 12:48 <bvancea> I've merged master into my branch a couple of times 12:49 <bvancea> so other commits are there as well 12:49 <sdumitriu1> git log -p --author=vancea 12:49 <bvancea> nice 12:51 <bvancea> so now that I've selected the commits, how should I store them? 12:51 <bvancea> to upload? 12:52 <sdumitriu1> Put them in a .patch file 12:52 <sdumitriu1> git log -p --author=vancea > bogdan_vancea__medsavant__gsoc13.patch 12:52 <bvancea> and them upload that? 12:52 <sdumitriu1> gzip it, then upload 12:52 <bvancea> I see, thanks 12:56 <bvancea> so after I'm done with the work on my feature branch, can I keep contributing to medsavant on other issues? 12:57 <sdumitriu1> Sure 12:57 <sdumitriu1> One of the goals of GSoC is to attract permanent contributors to open source projects 12:57 <sdumitriu1> If you liked MedSavant and you want to continue to contribute, then that's a bigger success 12:59 <sdumitriu1> And of course we'll be happy to have you around 13:00 <bvancea> well, I've seen a lot of new issues popping up 13:00 <bvancea> and I'm curious about them 13:01 <bvancea> I would like to continue contributing if I have time to spare from Uni 13:05 <bvancea> is there a hangout this week? 13:06 <sdumitriu1> There should be 13:06 <sdumitriu1> Nobody scheduled it yet, right? 13:07 <bvancea> yep, not scheduled 13:07 <bvancea> I can do a doodle if you want 13:07 <sdumitriu1> Yep, that would be great 13:27 <bvancea> I've reated 13:27 <bvancea> I've created the poll 15:21 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant
